title: Oulton Broad and Carlton Marshes Walking Route

images.title: Ashley Dace / Oulton Broad Swingbridge
images.caption: Oulton Broad Swingbridge. A view of the restored swing bridge at the Broad. Network rail have completed iron works and painting to make the structure look as built. The signal box is missing though, the remains to the far left.

images.title: Pete Chapman / Share Marsh, Near Oulton Broad
images.caption: Share Marsh, Near Oulton Broad. Share Marsh is typical of much of the low lying ground in the Waveney Valley. A network of dykes and water pumps keeps the land dry enough for cattle grazing (but not suitable for crops). The view shows one of the smaller dykes with a pair of swans (which are quite common in this area).

images.title: Pete Chapman / Wherry Hotel and Mutford Lock, Oulton Broad Lowestoft
images.caption: Wherry Hotel and Mutford Lock in 1989. This photo was taken from the end of a nearby jetty into the Broad. The entrance to the lock is near to the blue and red sign and is the southern link with the North Sea for the Norfolk Broads. The road bridge crossing over the top of the lock has been replaced since the photo was taken. The Wherry Hotel has been here for many years and offers good views over the Broad.

images.title: David Medcalf / Entrance to Oulton Broad, from Oulton Dyke
images.caption: Entrance to Oulton Broad, from Oulton Dyke

images.title: View across White Cast Marshes by Evelyn Simak, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Track in Carlton Marshes Nature Reserve by Evelyn Simak, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Track in Carlton Marshes Nature Reserve

description: This is a lovely waterside walk visiting Oulton Broad, the River Waveney and the pretty Carlton Marshes Nature Reserve near Lowestoft . The walk uses part of the long distance Angles Way and a series of other footpaths to explore the area. As well as the lovely Suffolk Broads scenery there's a huge variety of interesting wildlife. Look out for birds of prey including marsh harrier, barn owl and hobby. There's also lots of interesting plants including marsh orchid, marsh marigold and ragged-robin. You can start your walk from the Oulton Broad car park or from Oulton Broad South railway station. From here you can pick up the Angles Way footpath which will take you into the reserve. Trails then take you along the waterways including various dykes and the River Waveney. There's also nice views across the large expanse of water and marsh that is Oulton Broad. Look out for a variety of watersports taking place on the water. The broad is a popular tourist spot with lots of restaurants, cafes, pubs, bars and shops. You can extend your walking in the area by following the Angles Way along the northern side of the broad. The path then continues to Flixton Wood and Flixton Lake before coming to the delightul model village of Somerleyton . Continuing west along the Angles Way will take you along the River Waveney into Beccles .
